From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin convertere, with normal change of conjugation to -ir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kum.bərˈti]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [koɱ.vərˈti]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [koɱ.veɾˈtiɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

convertir (first-person singular present converteixo, first-person singular preterite convertí, past participle convertit)

  1. to convert
  2. (reflexive) to become

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of convertir (third conjugation, with -eix-)
infinitive convertir
gerund convertint
past participle masculine feminine
singular convertit convertida
plural convertits convertides
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès

imperfect convertia converties convertia convertíem convertíeu convertien
future convertiré convertiràs convertirà convertirem convertireu convertiran
preterite convertí convertires convertí convertírem convertíreu convertiren
conditional convertiria convertiries convertiria convertiríem convertiríeu convertirien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present converteixi converteixis converteixi convertim convertiu converteixin
imperfect convertís convertissis convertís convertíssim convertíssiu convertissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — converteix converteixi convertim convertiu converteixin
negative (no) — no converteixis no converteixi no convertim no convertiu no converteixin

Related terms

[edit]
  • conversió
  • convertible

Further reading

[edit]
  • “convertir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “convertir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “convertir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “convertir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old French convertir, from Latin convertō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kɔ̃.vɛʁ.tiʁ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (France (Toulouse)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

convertir

  1. to convert (change one thing into another)
  2. to convert (exchange one thing into another)
  3. to convert (to change someone's beliefs)
  4. to convert; to bring around (to change someone's mind or opinion)
  5. (reflexive) to become; to change into
  6. (reflexive) to convert (+ à = to)
    Elle s'est convertie à l'islam.
    She converted to Islam.

Conjugation

[edit]

This is a regular verb of the second conjugation, like finir, choisir, and most other verbs with infinitives ending in -ir. One salient feature of this conjugation is the repeated appearance of the infix -iss-.

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

    From Latin convertō.

    Verb

    [edit]

    convertir

    1. to convert (change from one state to another)

    Conjugation

    [edit]

    This verb conjugates as a third-group or second-group verb (ending in -ir, without or with an -iss- infix). Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

        Conjugation of convertir (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
    simple compound
    infinitive convertir avoir converti
    gerund en convertant, convertissant gerund of avoir + past participle
    present participle convertant, convertissant
    past participle converti
    person singular plural
    first second third first second third
    indicative jo tu il nos vos il
    simple
    tenses     		present convert, convertis converz, convertis convert, convertist convertons, convertissons convertez, convertissez convertent, convertissent
    imperfect convertoie, converteie, convertissoie, convertisseie convertoies, converteies, convertissoies, convertisseies convertoit, converteit, convertissoit, convertisseit convertiiens, convertiens, convertissiiens, convertissiens convertiiez, convertiez, convertissiiez, convertissiez convertoient, converteient, convertissoient, convertisseient
    preterite converti convertis converti convertimes convertistes convertirent
    future convertirai convertiras convertira convertirons convertiroiz, convertireiz, convertirez convertiront
    conditional convertiroie, convertireie convertiroies, convertireies convertiroit, convertireit convertiriiens, convertiriens convertiriiez, convertiriez convertiroient, convertireient
    compound
    tenses     		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
    pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
    past anterior preterite tense of avoir + past participle
    future perfect future tense of avoir + past participle
    conditional perfect conditional tense of avoir + past participle
    subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
    simple
    tenses     		present converte, convertisse convertes, convertisses converte, convertisse convertons, convertissons convertez, convertissez convertent, convertissent
    imperfect convertisse convertisses convertist convertissons, convertissiens convertissoiz, convertissez, convertissiez convertissent
    compound
    tenses     		past present subjunctive of avoir + past participle
    pluperfect imperfect subjunctive of avoir + past participle
    imperative – tu – nos vos –
    — convert, convertis — convertons, convertissons convertez, convertissez —

    Descendants

    [edit]
    • → Middle English: converten
      • English: convert
    • French: convertir

    Spanish

    [edit]

    Alternative forms

    [edit]
    • convertirse (reflexive)

    Etymology

    [edit]

    From Latin convertō.

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /kombeɾˈtiɾ/ [kõm.beɾˈt̪iɾ]
    • Rhymes: -iɾ
    • Syllabification: con‧ver‧tir

    Verb

    [edit]

    convertir (first-person singular present convierto, first-person singular preterite convertí, past participle convertido)

    1. (transitive) to convert
      • 2022 June 3, Sandee LaMotte, “El efecto 'Benjamin Button': científicos logran revertir el envejecimiento en ratones. El objetivo es hacer lo mismo con los humanos”, in CNN en Español‎[1]:
        Ahora él quiere cambiar el mundo y convertir el envejecimiento en una enfermedad”, dijo Whitney Casey, una inversionista que se asoció con Sinclair para crear una prueba de edad biológica casera. […] Sinclair también toma 1 gramo de NMN, o mononucleótido de nicotinamida, que en el cuerpo se convierte en NAD+, o dinucleótido de nicotinamida y adenina.
        Now he wants to change the world and turn aging into a disease," said Whitney Casey, an investor who partnered with Sinclair to create a home biological age test. […] Sinclair also takes 1 gram of NMN, or nicotinamide mononucleotide, which the body converts into NAD+, or nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide.
    2. (transitive) to turn
    3. (transitive) to transform
      Synonym: transformar
    4. (reflexive) [with en ‘something’] to become, get, turn into, transform
      Synonym: tornarse
      Se nos convirtió en un blanco.
      We were turned into a target

    Usage notes

    [edit]
    • convertirse en can proceed noun phrases but not adjectives. Compare hacerse, volverse, quedarse and ponerse.

    Conjugation

    [edit]
        Conjugation of convertir (e-ie-i alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
    infinitive convertir
    gerund convirtiendo
    past participle masculine feminine
    singular convertido convertida
    plural convertidos convertidas
    singular plural
    1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
    indicative yo tú
    vos     		él/ella/ello
    usted     		nosotros
    nosotras     		vosotros
    vosotras     		ellos/ellas
    ustedes
    present convierto conviertestú
    convertísvos     		convierte convertimos convertís convierten
    imperfect convertía convertías convertía convertíamos convertíais convertían
    preterite convertí convertiste convirtió convertimos convertisteis convirtieron
    future convertiré convertirás convertirá convertiremos convertiréis convertirán
    conditional convertiría convertirías convertiría convertiríamos convertiríais convertirían
    subjunctive yo tú
    vos     		él/ella/ello
    usted     		nosotros
    nosotras     		vosotros
    vosotras     		ellos/ellas
    ustedes
    present convierta conviertastú
    convirtásvos2     		convierta convirtamos convirtáis conviertan
    imperfect
    (ra)     		convirtiera convirtieras convirtiera convirtiéramos convirtierais convirtieran
    imperfect
    (se)     		convirtiese convirtieses convirtiese convirtiésemos convirtieseis convirtiesen
    future1 convirtiere convirtieres convirtiere convirtiéremos convirtiereis convirtieren
    imperative — tú
    vos     		usted nosotros
    nosotras     		vosotros
    vosotras     		ustedes
    affirmative conviertetú
    convertívos     		convierta convirtamos convertid conviertan
    negative no conviertas no convierta no convirtamos no convirtáis no conviertan

    1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
    2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

        Selected combined forms of convertir (e-ie-i alternation)

    These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

    singular plural
    1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
    with infinitive convertir dative convertirme convertirte convertirle, convertirse convertirnos convertiros convertirles, convertirse
    accusative convertirme convertirte convertirlo, convertirla, convertirse convertirnos convertiros convertirlos, convertirlas, convertirse

    accusative convirtiéndome convirtiéndote convirtiéndolo, convirtiéndola, convirtiéndose convirtiéndonos convirtiéndoos convirtiéndolos, convirtiéndolas, convirtiéndose
    with informal second-person singular tú imperative convierte dative conviérteme conviértete conviértele conviértenos not used conviérteles
    accusative conviérteme conviértete conviértelo, conviértela conviértenos not used conviértelos, conviértelas
    with informal second-person singular vos imperative convertí dative convertime convertite convertile convertinos not used convertiles
    accusative convertime convertite convertilo, convertila convertinos not used convertilos, convertilas
    with formal second-person singular imperative convierta dative conviértame not used conviértale, conviértase conviértanos not used conviértales
    accusative conviértame not used conviértalo, conviértala, conviértase conviértanos not used conviértalos, conviértalas
    with first-person plural imperative convirtamos dative not used convirtámoste convirtámosle convirtámonos convirtámoos convirtámosles
    accusative not used convirtámoste convirtámoslo, convirtámosla convirtámonos convirtámoos convirtámoslos, convirtámoslas
    with informal second-person plural imperative convertid dative convertidme not used convertidle convertidnos convertíos convertidles
    accusative convertidme not used convertidlo, convertidla convertidnos convertíos convertidlos, convertidlas
    with formal second-person plural imperative conviertan dative conviértanme not used conviértanle conviértannos not used conviértanles, conviértanse
    accusative conviértanme not used conviértanlo, conviértanla conviértannos not used conviértanlos, conviértanlas, conviértanse
